関連科目: Career Seminar for International Organizations, Management of International Organizations, Seminar in Global Communication, Seminar in Global Diversity
授業の概要・背景: Experiencing the entire process of conducting internship from searching for internship opportunities, preparing application documents, performing assigned tasks, and having their performance assessed, this class will provide students with opportunities to improve their knowledge and competencies to work for UN organisations. Students are expected to reflect their internship experiences to improve their career and competency development plans.
授業方法: Orientation, consultation, guidance and assessment before, during and after the internship

トピック.授業計画1:
Pre-departure programme:
1. Initial orientation and expression of their interest areas and organisations (at the beginning of the first year)
2. Assignment of students to relevant professors to get an advice from them.
3. Search for internship opportunities and selection of posts to apply for.
4. Preparation of application documents, including the letter of intent and curriculum vitae
5. Application to organisations (3-6 months prior to the start of internship)
6. Screening, interview, and acceptance of internship by selected organization/s
7. Preparation for departure

During internship:
1. Arrival, initial guidance, confirmation of terms of reference, and settlement. (first reporting)
2. Periodical and mid-term consultation with professors (email or video conference based)
3. Completion of assignment and assessment of internship by supervising officer. (As per Evaluation sheet)

After internship:
1. Final report of internship
2. Updating students’ career and competency development plans based on internship experience.
トピック.授業外学習2: This internship offers students a unique opportunity to simulate job application process and to obtain hands-on experience in working for UN agencies and other organisations.  It should be taken seriously throughout the internship processes. Students are expected to enhance their UN competencies including their core values and core competencies, as well as their understanding of the organisation that they apply for and conduct internship with.
